llvm-use-ranges.description:
Description

Finds calls to STL library iterator algorithms that could be replaced with
LLVM range-based algorithms from
llvm/ADT/STLExtras.h
.

Example
auto
it
=
std
::
find
(
vec
.
begin
(),
vec
.
end
(),
value
);
bool
all
=
std
::
all_of
(
vec
.
begin
(),
vec
.
end
(),
[](
int
x
)
{
return
x
>
0
;
});
Transforms to:
auto
it
=
llvm
::
find
(
vec
,
value
);
bool
all
=
llvm
::
all_of
(
vec
,
[](
int
x
)
{
return
x
>
0
;
});

Supported algorithms
Calls to the following STL algorithms are checked:
std::accumulate
,
std::adjacent_find
,
std::all_of
,
std::any_of
,
std::binary_search
,
std::copy_if
,
std::copy
,
std::count_if
,
std::count
,
std::equal
,
std::fill
,
std::find_if_not
,
std::find_if
,
std::find
,
std::for_each
,
std::includes
,
std::is_sorted
,
std::lower_bound
,
std::max_element
,
std::min_element
,
std::mismatch
,
std::none_of
,
std::partition_point
,
std::partition
,
std::remove_if
,
std::replace_copy_if
,
std::replace_copy
,
std::replace
,
std::search
,
std::stable_sort
,
std::transform
,
std::uninitialized_copy
,
std::unique
,
std::upper_bound
.
The check will add the necessary
#include
"llvm/ADT/STLExtras.h"
directive
when applying fixes.
llvm-use-ranges.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
